items.sentence: Tom realized he barely had enough money to buy what he needed to buy.
Tom rolled up his pant legs so people could see his bright red socks.
What was your relationship with your father like when you were a kid?
When I got out of jail, the first thing I did was go to a restaurant.
I don\'t think it will rain, but I\'ll take an umbrella just in case.
Don\'t you just hate the way Tom always monopolizes the conversation?
When Tom couldn\'t bear the pain any longer, he went to the hospital.
You should take your car to Tom\'s Garage. He does a pretty good job.
A few trees fell down in our neighborhood during the storm last week.
After working in the hot sun all afternoon, Tom looked hot and tired.
I came all this way. You could at least listen to what I have to say.
If I tell my mother, she\'ll worry, so I don\'t think I\'ll tell her.
Tom can\'t even play one song on his ukulele without making mistakes.
I put an advertisement in the newspaper saying my house was for sale.
I remember the event as clearly as if it had happened just yesterday.
I suggest that you go and see a doctor about this as soon as you can.
I think that perhaps both Tom and Mary have forgotten how to do that.
I want to apologize for the way I talked to you the last time we met.
I think I\'ve figured out which horse is most likely to win the race.
I\'ve heard that in Germany beer is cheaper than water. Is that true?
